```{r}
#Import Libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(stringr)
library(dplyr)

```


```{r}
#Data import
adult_info <- read.csv("/Users/allenmiller/Documents/GitHub/6372---50k-Income-Predictor/Data/adult.data.csv", header = TRUE)
str(adult_info)
View(adult_info)

#Dummy set for easy rollback of data
dummy <- adult_info



#Looking for Null Values
#No Nulls found in the dataset
sapply(dummy, function(x) sum(is.na(x)))


#Looking at data types
str(dummy)



#Replace the "?" in Workclass with "none" and change to factor
dummy$workclass <- dummy$workclass %>% str_replace("\\?", "None")
dummy$workclass <- as.factor(dummy$workclass)
str(dummy$workclass)
unique(dummy$workclass)



#Save point
adult_info <- dummy

#Change Education to a factor
dummy$education <- as.factor(dummy$education)
str(dummy$education)
unique(dummy$education)


#Change Marital.Status to a factor
#We may want to look into what some of these mean and potentially combine levels
dummy$marital.status <- as.factor(dummy$marital.status)
str(dummy$marital.status)
unique(dummy$marital.status)


#change Occupation to factor
#Once again lets look at narrowing down some levels
dummy$occupation <- dummy$occupation %>% str_replace("\\?", "Unknown")
dummy$occupation <- as.factor(dummy$occupation)
str(dummy$occupation)
unique(dummy$occupation)


#save point
adult_info <- dummy


#change relationship to factor
#What even is this variable? 
dummy$relationship <- as.factor(dummy$relationship)
str(dummy$relationship)
unique(dummy$relationship)


#change race to factor
dummy$race <- as.factor(dummy$race)
str(dummy$race)
unique(dummy$race)


#change sex to factor
dummy$sex <- as.factor(dummy$sex)
str(dummy$sex)
unique(dummy$sex)


#change native.country to factor
#This is a lot of levels. Are they all useful to us in this format?
dummy$native.country <- dummy$native.country %>% str_replace("\\?", "Other")
dummy$native.country <- as.factor(dummy$native.country)
str(dummy$native.country)
unique(dummy$native.country)


#change class to factor
dummy$class <- as.factor(dummy$class)
str(dummy$class)
unique(dummy$class)
```
